children.text: When providing intimate care (nappy Changing)
It is our aim to ensure that children are kept clean and comfortable by being changed and checked on a regular basis. Approximately every 2 hrs.
Children’s privacy will be treated with respect. Nappy changing will not be rushed but used as an opportunity for one-to-one exchanges of conversation and smiles.

Admission discussions with parents/carers will indicate if their child may need special requirements due to sensitive skin, Wellyboots will cater for each child’s individual needs to their highest ability.

Wellyboots will provide all wet wipes and nappies but at the registration meeting this will be discussed and parents are given the option to provide wipes, creams and nappies should they wish to, such items will be only used on the child they are intended for. Wellyboots will provide nappy ointment but should a parent wish it they can provide this and it will then be stored in the childs individual tray for use only on that child. Nappy ointments will be stored safely in the changing unit, clearly labelled and practitioners. No visitors/students will be permitted to change children at any point.
Our nappy changing procedure is as follows:
Children who are soiled will be changed immediately.
Gloves and aprons will be worn by practitioners.
Practitioners will collect all items needed before changing the child.
Children will be encouraged to climb up the steps of the changing unit to position themselves on the changing mat.
Children will not be left unattended on the changing mat.
Wet/soiled nappies will be removed and the child cleaned with baby wipes (unless aware of allergy) from front to back.
If needed, cream will be applied and then clean nappy will be put on.
Changing mat will be sprayed with sanitising spray and wiped thoroughly with a cloth.
Soiled nappies, used wipes, gloves and aprons will be disposed of in the designated bin provided.
Hands will be washed thoroughly following recommended handwashing procedures.
Toileting
We promote independent toileting for all children who have reached this stage.
No visitors/students will be permitted in the toilet area at any point. Our toileting procedure is as follows:
Children are encouraged to ask a practitioner if they need to use the toilet.
• Children are not to be unsupervised when in the toilet area. (This arrangement enables toileting to be more closely monitored by practitioners.)
• Children will be encouraged to clean and wipe themselves after toilet use.
Practitioners will check children afterwards and if they are required to they will wipe children.
Practitioners will use disposable protective equipment e.g. gloves and aprons.
Children will be encouraged to tend to their personal hygiene needs.
Practitioners will supervise hand washing afterwards and provide help should it be required.
Practitioners will take all necessary measures to safeguard themselves when they are toileting children, for example, leaving toilet doors open at all times when in the cubicle with a child.
Any suspicious acts will be dealt with immediately and necessary action will be taken.
No adults can enter the toilet area unless they are designated practitioners.
Parents/carers may change their child/attend to their child in the toilet/nappy changing area if there are no other children present in the bathroom area.
Practitioners will check before permitting access.
